item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#995)—Answers for Monday, March 2
item.content:encoded:
It’s a new week, and it’s an important one! This is when you’ll see the 1000th NYT Connections puzzle land, so expect some interesting challenges to surface as the week goes on. Today, we’re one step closer to that milestone with #995, which is a neat one to start your week with.

If you’re coming out of a sweet weekend and preparing to start a busy work week, make sure you kick it off the right way with a spot of NYT Connections success. Below, you’ll find the hints and answers you need.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing lineup of the New York Times titles. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (March 2)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • SPRING
  • RANK
  • RUBBER

  • VAULT

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words you’d associate with a gymnast’s performance
  • Green – Words you’d associate with someone’s status
  • Blue -Words you’d associate with calls in baseball
  • Purple – Words oyu’d associate with ‘chicken’

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, March 2:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, March 2 (#995)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – BEAM, HORSE, RINGS, VAULT
  • Green – POSITION, RANK, STANDING, STATION
  • Blue – BALL, FOUL, SAFE, STRIKE
  • Purple – FUNKY, POPCORN, RUBBER, SPRING

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

item.title: Marathon’s Server Slam Didn’t Gain Traction This Weekend, But It Still Topped Some Titans
item.content:encoded:
Marathon’s server slam started on Thursday, and within a couple of hours, hundreds of thousands of people had either downloaded it and started playing or started watching it on a streaming platform somewhere. It picked up pace, hit more than 143,000 concurrent players on Steam alone, and then promptly fizzled.

Within six hours, the peak dropped by 30,000 players, and by the following evening, it was peaking at half the original high. Many believed the weekend would yield some gains as players worldwide came off work and into Bungie’s Marathon, but it wasn’t to be. That being said, the server slam still managed to top some titans on Steam.

Marathon Could Go Either Way

Marathon didn’t make immense waves in the gaming space this weekend, but it still beat the likes of Battlefield 6 and Call of Duty.

It’s no big secret that these two titanic franchises have had their fair share of issues in the last few months. Black Ops 7 launched to a woeful reception and is suffering immensely at the hands of a disinterested community. On the other hand, Battlefield 6 continues to flounder amidst poor updates and a slow change cadence.

Marathon will be the ‘new shiny thing’ this month when it launches on March 5, marking Bungie’s long-awaited entry into the extraction shooter space. It’s going up against some monumental competition, especially in the form of both ARC Raiders and Escape from Tarkov, but tens of thousands of people have already gotten a taste of Marathon and (likely) want more.

At the time of writing, Marathon’s server slam product had a 24-hour peak player count of 76,437 users on Steam. This is how that stacks up against other, similar games on the platform:

  • ARC Raiders – 227,765
  • Apex Legends – 201,571
  • Marathon – 76,437
  • Battlefield 6 – 71,861
  • Call of Duty – 52,575
  • Escape from Tarkov – 19,220
  • Destiny 2 – 11,623

The discourse around Marathon has been pretty mixed. There’s enough positivity there for the game to enjoy a semi-decent launch, but only if Bungie can deliver a strong roadmap and rapid enough updates. The team has already been addressing the game’s biggest gripes, including concerns around the complex UI, the lack of PvP, and optimization issues on PC platforms.

Unfortunately, Marathon is also going to be a game that lives or dies by its viewership, such is the life of extraction games. If the creators can get hooked, they’ll retain an audience and keep feeding people into the game, but if that doesn’t happen, Marathon will surely plummet.

In the opening hours of the server slam, Marathon secured a peak of around 301,000 viewers on Twitch, and then, thanks to a huge push from popular streamers, it edged past that to hit 350,000 on Sunday, March 1. That was short-lived, though. The peak came at around 7 PM GMT, and by 10 PM GMT, only 70,000 people were watching the game.

It should be stressed that this isn’t a negative take of Marathon’s performance, as such. This is a game that could offer a sorely needed shake-up to the extraction genre, in a way that ARC Raiders managed to do in October 2025. It’s unique enough to leave a mark on the space, but the longevity of the thing is yet to be witnessed.

Do you think Marathon is going to stick the landing, or will it falter at first? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1717: Hints and Answer for March 2, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1717 for March 2, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, March 2, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1717 isn’t too challenging. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 3.8 out of 6 guesses. That makes it slightly easier than the 4.3-guess average from March 1.

General Wordle Hints For March 2

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is often associated with texture rather than appearance.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly used when something is unpleasant to touch.
  • Hint 3: The term shows up more in casual descriptions than formal writing.
  • Hint 4: You’re more likely to encounter it when describing a mess or residue than something clean.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1712 for March 2, 2026.

Starter Words For March 2, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • LUCKY
  • FLUID
  • FLESH
  • BULKY

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1717 On March 2, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: SLIME

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

SLIME can be both a noun and a verb. As a noun, it means a “thin, glutinous mud.” As a verb, it means “to cover or smear with or as if with slime.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1716 on March 1, 2026

Answer: FLUKE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1717?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on March 3 will be Wordle Game #1718.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: SAROS Dev Housemarque Staffing up for Next Project
item.content:encoded:
Housemarque currently has multiple job openings. They are gearing up for their next project.

Housemarque is the maker of Returnal and the upcoming PlayStation 5 exclusive, SAROS. While the latter has yet to be released, new job listings on the company’s official website show what they are looking for in their next project.

Details on Housemarque Job Listings

There are currently six openings at the company, one of which is for the Principal Graphics Programmer. The job listing notes that they will work closely with the team, specifically the Technical Art Director, Technical Director, and Graphics Architect, to help drive the next evolution of games at the studio.

“Together with the team, you will push innovation in ray tracing, lighting, and shading, turning fresh ideas into practical solutions, whether through GPGPU techniques or real-time ML and tensor computing,” the listing notes.

Additionally, they are looking for someone with 8+ years of experience in graphics programming for similar projects, including at least one shipped AAA video game. Notably, they are also requesting a candidate specifically passionate about pushing Fidelity on PlayStation hardware.

Lead Gameplay Animator Listing Specifically for Upcoming Game

They’re also looking for a lead gameplay animator. This listing specifically notes that they are working on the “next groundbreaking title” from the team. Potential candidates should have a background in gameplay animation for AAA games, preferably in a leadership position.

“If you’re a seasoned gameplay animation leader with a passion for developing both ideas and people, you’ll thrive in our collaborative environment. While we appreciate self-starters who are eager to learn new techniques, we also value team players who can contribute to a larger vision,” the listing reads.

All positions are local to Helsinki, Finland. Those interested can learn more here.

For more on SAROS, check out the latest drop from the most recent Sony State of Play presentation.
